did.abstract: The Philippine zines reflects the feelings, aesthetics, and cultural and political ideologies of various individuals and artist collectives from the Philippines. The zine's content mostly includes creative works, such as comics, illustrations, poetry, and short stories to reflect topics, such as mental health, interpersonal relationships, culture, political climate, and more. The Philippine zines spans the years of 2006-2017, with the bulk of the material from 2017.
did.physloc: Stored off-site. All requests to access special collections material must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.
did.langmaterial: Materials are predominantly in Tagalog and English, with Taglish, a code-switch between Tagalog and English, used often. There are a few zines that are in Cebuano and Ilocano, languages that are native to the Philippines.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research. All requests to access special collections materials must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Reproduction and Use
userestrict.p: Property rights to the objects belong to UCLA Library Special Collections. All other rights, including copyright, are retained by the creators and their heirs. It is the responsibility of the researcher to determine who holds the copyright and pursue the copyright owner or his or her heir for permission to publish where The UC Regents do not hold the copyright.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: All zines have been purchased through zine fairs and a seller based in the Philippines by Jade Alburo, Librarian for Southeast Asian Studies, Pacific Islands Studies, and Religion at UCLA Library.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Philippine zines collection (Collection 2281). UCLA Library Special Collections, Charles E. Young Research Library, University of California, Los Angeles.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Processed by Valerie Vargas in 2018, under the supervision of Jade Alburo and Jasmine Jones; and Alejandro Adame and Rosemary Medina in 2019, under the supervision by Jasmine Jones.

Collections are processed to a variety of levels depending on the work necessary to make them usable, their perceived user interest and research value, availability of staff and resources, and competing priorities. Library Special Collections provides a standard level of preservation and access for all collections and, when time and resources permit, conducts more intensive processing. These materials have been arranged and described according to national and local standards and best practices.

We are committed to providing ethical, inclusive, and anti-racist description of the materials we steward, and to remediating existing description of our materials that contains language that may be offensive or cause harm. We invite you to submit feedback about how our collections are described, and how they could be described more accurately, by filling out the form located on our website: Report Problematic Content and Description in UCLA's Library Collections and Archives.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: In the 1980s, Philippine zine culture first emerged, as a result of music fan zines that were introduced at the same time punk music was being introduced in the country. Contemporarily, the content of the zines Filpinos produce have expanded to explore different themes such as personal, political, cultural, literary, art, feminism, and more. The zine culture flourished in the 2000s due to the emergence of the digital age that allowed artists to post their zines on different platforms. Zine culture, however, was catalyzed by the emergence of a small press conference called Better Living Through Xeroxography (BLTX). This press conference was founded on empowering artists through the highlighting of problems in mainstream publishing and introducing self-publication as a solution. BLTX was able take the discontent over mainstream publishing and push for a way to educate and mobilize to address it through artistic means.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The Philippine zines reflects the feelings, aesthetics, and cultural and political ideologies of various individuals and artist collectives from the Philippines. The zine's content mostly includes creative works, such as comics, illustrations, poetry, and short stories to reflect topics, such as mental health, interpersonal relationships, culture, political climate, and more. The Philippine zines spans the years of 2006-2017, with the bulk of the material from 2017.

The collection features zines from various individuals or collaborators who circulate their creations in small press expos, like Better Living Through Xeroxography (BLTX), or through local collectives, like Magpies Press, Saturnino Basilla Studio, and Soup Zine Library. Many of the zines from this collection are also a product from local universities' organizations or clubs, where students have collaborated to publish and print their work together.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection has been intellectually arranged by title.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This untitled zine consists of collages of maps and pictures of the San Francisco Bay Area. It also includes a short poem and an extracted explanation about plate tectonics, which the author uses as a metaphor of the constantly changing relationships in our own lives. The zine concludes with a small text of retractions to form a new message of the inevitable uncertainty of coming and going.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The stories and poems in the zine feature literal wars people have to fight during the holiday, as well as the struggle of people to pay bills or provide for their families.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The zine, with photocollages, doodles, and poem, is centered around being remembered and longing, which are expressed through the concept of hands and holding on. Though some lines from the poems correlate with the images, some of them appear to not be related.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This is an artist dump of various sketches, doodles, poems, short stories, photographs, and collages. The short stories are written around the theme of abandoning nature, in the representation of a pet dog abandoned, the earth recovering from human greed, and an imagined world in the skies.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: An art zine by a musician who realizes that every craft will not be executed perfectly after the first try. He decides to paint, for fun, and ends up enjoying the process even if the results wasn't what he expected. The paintings in the zine are inspired by elements from the grunge and classical rock music scene, including long hair and guitars.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: #PINKFOREVER is a photozine that connects various pantone pink colors with matching photos. Images in the photozine include bridges, buildings, vending machines, furniture and accessories in various shades of pink.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This is a collage styled zine printed in black ink on yellow paper. It is centered around the same situational themes with different points of view. The + collages in this zine were made by Ty, while the - collages were made by Acie.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This is an auto-biographical comic about Rob Cham's journey to becoming a comic artist.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 26% by Vianca Delacruz is a zine that was published by Saturnino Basilla in Manila, Philippines. This zine centers on drawings, collages and photographs.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This zine is covered in a textured orange cardstock with green pages inside. It is illustrated with accompanying text.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A collage zine about traffic in Manila, Philippines.

controlaccess.geogname: Epifanio de los Santos Avenue (Manila, Philippines)
controlaccess.subject: Traffic
Transportation

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The zine contains photos of trees, windows from the inside, plants, the sky, and more. Each photo takes up about a third of each page, execpt for the middle spread, which holds a photo of a tree from inside the house, and through the window. a window with big panes.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Adelaine is a short graphic novel with text that tells of the narrator's complicated relationship with his daughter, Adelaine. The cover is yellow with an orang spine while the story is in black and white.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A short zine with a comic about quitting cigaretes, remembering smells, forgetting details but remembering intimate ones over time.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This zine is broken up into two sections: "Surreal" and "Some Final Notions on Adulthood." It is in black and white with the cover printed in color on laminated paper.

did.unittitle: The Adventures of Team Pom: Squid Happens

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This is a short comic, printed in two colors on risograph, is by a Brooklyn-based Filipina artist who employs a minimalist art style. It is about three, very different young girls brought together by their love of a show called Diving Divas, who make up a synchronized swimming team named Team Pom.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This short comic is about a young boy and girl who constantly clash with each other. After a fight, the boy gets a visit from his future self who advises him to talk to the girl. The boy is suspicious of the advise, but helps out the girl shortly after she is caught in a downpour with a broken umbrella.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A script for a play that was written for the event Deus Sex Machina, a live comedy erotica live-reading show in Manila. In this script, four women in an agency are assigned to collect ingredients for a new product.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A self-published graphic novel tells the story of Kokoy, an orphan who used his love for his friend, Clara to encourage himself to acheive his life goals in order to gain a relationship with her.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A short folded zine about strong pangs of heartache and the attempt to dull it down with alcohol.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A zine bound together by a book ring, each page split for images and words. It is about the dynamic progression of a relationship of sharing comfort and doubt.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This zine is about complicated feelings of becoming an adult and the uncertainty that comes with decision making.

did.unittitle: Anathema (On Notes On Things We Hate)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This zine consists of poems based on different things the writer hates. Some of the notes are accompanied by simple, black, inky sketches. The cover is of a person sitting with a cup of coffee.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The cover is black with a purple portrait outline of a woman. This is a series of entries that tells the story of a woman's fears of being abandoned by her husband, the perspective of a young mistress, passage about the drug wars, and the feelings of love, loss and acceptance.

did.unittitle: Ang Abakada Ng Tunay Na Pag-Ibig

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Abakada ng Tunay na Pagibig is a poem that goes through the Abakada alphabet, or the indigenized version of the Latin alphabet, to convey Brian Vee's love for his girlfriend. This poem was originally created for spoken word before becoming a zine. The zine has minimalist illustrations that compliment the story.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A comedic take on how the word "Chismis" (or gossip) came to be.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This is a compilation of poems from the perspective of workers from factories and call centers. In these poems, the extent that workers have to go to in order to keep their jobs is reflected.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Ang Hardin Ni Nene was originally written for the very first Deus Sex Machina, Metro Manila's comedic erotica live reading show. This story about sex references the Filipino folklore song, "bahay kubo," and is paired with illustrations of the vegetables mentioned in that song to appear as an innocent zine for non-Filipino readers.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The drawings in this zine are inspired by the Major Arcana tarot deck and represent historic, cultural, or political icons from the Philippines. The images and words are translated into Filipino.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A humorous short zine about a boy finding out that his roommate is an aswang (a shapeshifting monster).

did.unittitle: Ang Una Kong Pag-gawa ng Komix

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Fabo's story of how he approached and created his very first comic.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: These zines by Rizalino Noble Malabad were published by Magpies Press in University of the Philippines Los Ba√±os. In this collection are the zines ang/lou 1: politics and ang/lou: teorya. They are written in English and Filipino.

did.unittitle: 1: politics: for we know and cannot unknow / 2: identity: not being at home

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Astronaut is a worldless comic about a girl who wears an astronaut suit to leave her house.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Baby Love is a zine that probes a conversation around bestiality and zoophilia. There are references to religious stories and mythology to provide context to the phenomena. This zine is written in English and features doodles over screencaps, pages with religious stories, and pages with definitions of human/animal figures and deities from different religions and cultures.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Doodles on newspapers from Baguio City.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Bagyo is a compilation of poems and stories by students of the University of the Philippines.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: "Bakemono" is the Japanese word for monster. The comic follows Max, a vampire and the son of the high school's principal, as he anxiously faces his first day at school, and makes new friends.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A compilation of responses from the prompt, "Bakit Nga Ba__?" This prompt, which translates to "Why is it that__," or simply, "Why __?" urged a general audience to submit prompts by filling in the blank. Various writers from the Midnight Collective answered the questions through short stories or poems. The cover is upside down.

did.unittitle: A Balut Ate My Luois Vuitton

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This is a short comic about a grandma telling her impatient grandson how a balut ate her Louis Vuitton bag when she came back to the Philippines from being an OFW (overseas Filipino worker).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A series of poems that discuss uncomfortable thoughts and feelings.

did.unittitle: 1 Beg Komiks a Project Bayani Imprint
2 Beg Komiks a Project Bayani Imprint
3 Beg Komiks a Project Bayani Imprint

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A fold out zine that features a water color painting for each day of the week. Once the zine is folded out, the message "Buhay is Life," which is translates to "Life is Life" is shown.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A zine that uses different characters and languages, including English, Arabic, and Cyrillic. It contains sketches of bird diagrams, photographs, recipes and more.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This is a photozine with 28 black and white photos.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Three stories about relationships that are semi-autobiographical. Each zine tells the story of a teenage girl and her boyfriend. Themes include heartache, jealousy and depression.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A superhero comic.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This zine uses flowers to illustrate different stages of love and life.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A colorful, mini-fold out zine about someone going into a woman's house who recently passed away and reflecting on everything she left behind.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A colorful, mini-fold out zine about someone going into a woman's house who recently passed away and reflecting on everything she left behind.

did.unittitle: A book for suny days: Almond milk and sea salt scrub
BOSO: A Peep in Pinoy Bomba Komiks

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: In the Philippines, Bomba Komiks is the general term applied to adult-oriented comics that contain graphic nudity and sexual themes. This zine was prefaced with the question, why read pornography? Saturnino Basilla aims to reclaim pornography, where people's most repressed feelings, experiences, feelings about those experiences, and experiences about those feelings can be reflected. These comics are not to be seen as pornographic content only, but as a means of resistance against censorship.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This comic documented Rob's emotional journey as he went through his first break up.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A wordless comic about an office girl who wants nothing more than to get a cup of hot chocolate milk.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Marius Black's alter ego's poetry. The light blue book has Filipino poems about pining and sex, while the light pink ones features poems around the same themes, but are in English.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A short comic about a man who runs into repeated misfortune.

did.unittitle: Buti pa ang Cupcake ma fillings

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: BUXXXOM GRIND is a zine created by Dina Gadia, and published in Manila, Philippines. It contains collaged images of women that are printed on pink paper and in black ink.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Byaheng Pinoy (Pinoy Travels) is a Taglish oneshot comic that tells the everyday experiences of a commuter in Manila through slapstick humor.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Cact Luv is a zine by Keeshia Felipe or "Kita" filled with drawings that mix the elements of cute and tough. Most of the illustrations include doodles of young girls, cute skulls, fashion, and daily activities like thrift shopping and eating french fries.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Census of San Malo is a comic inspired by a throwaway line about "certain tribes" in the Philippines from H.P. Lovecraft's "Call of the Cthulhu." It is about a Katipunero who investigates whether forced labor is happening in San Malo, which only has 28 families with no more than two children each.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Cheesyfit is an illustrated joke book containing funny pick-up lines in English and Tagalog.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Flavor Issue of Chernila is a compilation of short comics that are about relationships, friendships, and childhood imagination.

did.unittitle: The Chibi Collection of 2 Sentence Horror Stories!

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A zine with a compilation of 2-sentence horror stories, along with a matching chibi (Japanese slang for short or little) drawing for each one.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A collection of three short stories of a girl recalling her past relationship through a series of questions, to a girl coined as chlorine atom girl because she dissolves from the lives of men quickly, and to a nonlinear story that shows how a man got to the point of jumping off a building.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The zine contains a compilation of alternative photography by different artists that contains sensual, sexual, and mundane images.

did.unittitle: The Chronicles of Chin Chin and Timmy

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A compilation of poems, short stories, and diary entrees that record the course and progression of an unrequited love from a mother to a jeepney driver she runs into, and befriends.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes original art and fan art by Chuck Llanto. The illustrations and doodles are centered around single-person characters, who are portrayed in each page in full color.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The suicide of Lee, or Julia Louise Buencamino, a 15-year old actor in the Philippines left a great period of grief for her loved ones. "Club." is a what Hope Swann dubs the group of people that were listed in Lee's suicide letter. This zine sorts out the feelings of guilt and grief about the suicide, and walks through the events that happened afterwards.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A risograph printed zine that uses only primary colors.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: An adult-themed coloring book by Nick Trinidad. The works in this comic book feature women in the nude, or in suggestive outfits and poses.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Coloring books by the same artist with different themes ranging from food and fashion, to crime scenes. Some of the coloring books are more interactive, prompting the user to also use their imagination and draw in some of the pages.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A 2-color risograph zine that contains a cut and paste collage in blue, black, and white.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A short story by a Messiahian artist from Manila about a super smart young girl, her aunt's failing marriage, and the chase to reveal her uncle's misdoings.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This comic is collaborated by a group of friends and tells a story from the perspective of a cat.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A compilation of colorful photography from Pasig to Quiapo that captures sari sari stores, people, flyers, parol, jeepneys, and more.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This is a collection of four panel comic strips in Taglish that shows the playful banter between "Cupcake" and "Muffin" as they go on their real life adventures.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This is a two-sided zine published by Magpies Press in 2014. The zine is focused on abusive and traumatic relationships between the creators and their mothers/fathers. It contains poems, comic strips, and illustrations in English and Tagalog to portray the negative impact that parent's actions, expectations, and words have taken on their children's mental and emotional health.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Ilokano poems based on the epic poem, "Biag ni Lam-ang."

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: Office of the Public Health Dentist of the Rural Health Unit (Rosales, Pangasinan)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Dentista Ni Tomas is a comic that was created in collaboration between the Office of the Public Health Dentist of the Rural Health Unit in Pangasinan and Ruth Hanzessa Rodriguez for the National Oral Health Month Celebration. The comic is aimed to teach children morals of good oral health, and was distributed to dental clinics and public schools in the Philippines.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Derail is a collection of sketches in black ink that is thematically centered around the war on drugs that president Rodrigo Duterte waging on poor people of the Philippines. Some of the images depict the infamous duct-taped heads used to hide the faces of the victims.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A chapbook with an assortment of short letters dedicated to different things. The short fragments are split into four parts: A memory, a dream, I, and to Dearest.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A comic about a rebellious young girl who gets scolded for acting "like a tomboy" because she wears her hair short and loves to skate.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: In this mini comic, Danielle Rina introduces herself a socially avoidant person who likes to drown in music, eat fast food late at night, and overthink past interactions with friends.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A collection of poems and short stories that talk about the different experiences and struggles of modern Filipina women and girls. It is in Taglish and some shorties include photos.

did.unittitle: Don't be a drag, just be a Queen
Don't Think About It: A Growing List of Things To Not Think About

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This zine presents a list of things thought about as the creator went through a period of depression from 2013-2014. The illustrations and comic strips touch on comfort food, nostalgia, random musings about ukay ukay, and difficulty with social interactions.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This item is the third installation to Dean Zuberi Africa's self published Doom Mountain comic series. The first few pages of the comic shows a chained up man being held captive on Doom Mountain before he was forced to take a concoction that gave him fearful visions and hallucinations. The panels of the comic are not accompanied with dialogue or words.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A zine with photos and text that reveals Judy Rival's childhood dreams.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Dulces Suenos was created in 2015 by Daniel Collado, a Spaniard artist in the Philippines. The comic follows Ana, a young woman who dreamt that her parents died, only for them to pass the following morning.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Dust of Men is a zine that contains grey graphite drawings of skulls, occult elements, and other distorted figures.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Dwopke is a collaborative zine between Meatfist and Noel Villa. The content of the zines are stream of thoughts jotted down and provided illustrations in hopes to unravel the secrets of the unconscious.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This zine illustrates some of Abi Goy's random memories of food from her childhood.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: "Eh Ano Ngayon" translates to "So What Now." compilation of Marvel superheroes depicted in funny, compromising, or both situations.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: EM zine is a collection of prose, poems, and panel-style illustrations of fictional works across various topics, but mostly, relationships.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Empty Your Cages is a zine that consists of five English poems by Kabel Mishka Ligot, and an illustration to match each one by Mary Elizabeth Or. The poems are about Jesus, swimming pools, and moaning. The subjects of these poems reflect the tensions that arise when queerness, sexuality, and religion are all put in the same arena.

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Materials
separatedmaterial.p: This illustrated zine shows a storm over the Philipphines.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A compilation of comic strips, illustrations, and poetry by different artists that reflect their everyday demons, which can be self deprecating humor, or other people tormenting them. There is no uniformity to the art style or content of the different submissions in this zine.

did.unittitle: Everyday I Wish I Were A Badass Superhero

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A comic about an office worker who daydreams about being a superhero in his childhood.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A zine that reflects an illicit relationship between a student and her teacher.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A mini-comic in Filipino that illustrates how depression and mental health can eat up a person. It shows how mental health impacts the way time is spent, and how many opportunities are taken or missed because of it.

did.unittitle: The Face of a Marcos Apologist

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 'Famous' is comprised of art drawn in traditional mediums, including pencil, marker, but mostly pen ink. The images produced stray away and strain the idea of what is desirable in art, especially in the Philippines.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: First Considerations, Huling Habilin (Last Will), created by Rolf Campos in 2014, serves as a template for a person's last will and testament. The pages are filled with anatomy doodles, designated areas to paste photos, final wishes for loved ones, and questions that range from asking about basic information, to deeply personal sentiments about life, death, and regrets.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This thin, xeroxed zine by Marianne Cadiz contains erasure poetry, which reveals a message about embracing pain as an act of sacrifice for love.

did.unittitle: Forgive them, Lewitt, For They Know Not What They're Saying

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This is a transcript from a talk given at the Artists' Forum on Conceptual Art Practice, Held at the Cultural Center of the Philippines on 22 March 2012.

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: University of the Philippines at Los Ba√±os

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A compilation of comics created by students from a recognized socio-cultural organization in the University of the Philippines Los Ba√±os.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: FUCKING ROCKSTAZZ is a zine by Patrick "Rawwrr" Enrique depicting popular icons such as Jesus Christ, Darth Vader, and the Philippine's national hero Jose Rizal as rockstars.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Gatang ng Saging is a minicomic by Rommel "Omeng" Estanislao that was published in 2010. The zine gives a brief explanation of what an "anting-anting" is, gives an example of items considered to be an anting-anting in th Philippines. The comic shows a man who went to gain powers by swallowing a talisman-milk from a banana tree.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This comic by Daniel Collado illustrates his take on what characteristics Geeks have. The zine is printed in black, white and grey.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This is a comic of a fictional take on how society progressed from archeic humans, and how fire was first discovered.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A comic about an Ipis, or a cockroach, that is widely shunned by society.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A compilation of different graphic novels and comics that each tell vastly different stories. They are on a wide range of art styles, genres, and story lines that will cater to various audiences. Only two pages are in Filipino, while the rest are in English.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A short comic about animal sailors trying to deliver gravy, but were used as bait against a sea monster.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This comic is a modern take on the story between Sidapa, the deity of death, and Bulan, one of the seven moon deities, in Philippine mythology. Because these deities hail from the Bicol and Visaya region, the comic was named after the Cebuano word for "love."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A zine with comics that go through the different phases after a break up. The first zine shows the liberating aspect of being single again, while the second zine reflects the regret of choosing to end the relationship in hindsight.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A short folded zine that talks about the idea that there are more people who are more interested in sex, and noncommitted relationships, than there are that do.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A short comic about a 23 year old woman who falls in love with a narcissist. She reflects on her dynamic with this man, and how they went from having something really good, to having nothing between them.

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: Philippine High School for the Arts

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A wordless comic about soldiers in a dug-out.

did.unittitle: High Fives and Neil Young For the Road

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: High Fives and Neil Young for the Road is an "outtakes" zine for the comic of Claire's dog following his death, but it is more of an outtakes of the process to get creativity flowing to finish the comic. In this, Claire goes through 'Writing the Unthinkable' exercises, an activity from Lynda Barry's book as part of an intensive writing workshop to word flowing from both writers and non-writers.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A Spaniard in Manila Hola Filipinas! is a minicomic by Daniel Collado that was published in May 2014. Each page details the adventures and misadventures of Felipe, a Spaniard expat, as he gets accustomed to everyday Filipino customs and traditions in Manila.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This comic focuses on a twin sister and the grief experienced following the death of her sister. The narrator questions the meaning of home.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This photozine is Saturnino Basilla's 6th item, which was printed in Manila, Philippines. This photozine contains screencaps from erotic/pornographic films: 'Barbara Broadcast', 'Behind the Green Door', 'Beyond Shame', 'Devil in Miss Jones', 'Erotic Night of the Livign Dead', 'Erotikill', 'Itallian Stallion', 'Space Thing', 'Story of O', and 'Talk Dirty to me'. Despite the mature source of the images, the photozine only includes a couple of explicit images, and primarily focuses on shots that showcase the characters in their homes.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Gioseppe Custodio makes a comic for every hour on the day of his birthday.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A poetry book in Filipino that surrounds the idea of being too much and not enough. There are 18 poems that are written around this theme of worth.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The pages in this zine are lined with caricaturized pop culture icons and characters who bear symbols like upside-down crosses, swastikas, and the KKK hood. Some drawings are offensive.

did.unittitle: I Draw What People I Don't Know Talk About In The Food Court

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A compilation of drawings of what Ev Yu overhears from other people in food courts. The panels contan minimal pieces of the conversations heard at food courts, but are interpreted in more abstract images instead.

did.unittitle: If You Fall, You Fall Alone

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This is a catalog of Allan Balisi's solo exhibition at Blanc Gallery. 'If You Fall, You Fall Alone' presents a series of monochromatic paintings with subtle hints of blue, green, brown, and other muted colors. The oil paintings mixed with graphite stand alone and are only given context by their cryptic titles.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A compliation of English and Filipino poems, short stories, and illustrations from different artists about secrets and the surprising ways they are found out.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A collection of ramblings, photos, illustrations, and poems on bipolar disorder. This zine serves as a reminder from the author to others who have bipolar disorder that they are not alone. The poems and ramblings that touch on depression and self harm are a cries for help and calls of solidarity at the same time.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This is a coloring and drawing booklet by Karize Michella Uy, which was first printed in September 2013. The illustrations in the zine are printed in a light grey, and feature small everyday items to be colored in-ranging from video game controllers, to first aid kits, to tombstones.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This zine contains different short comics about everyday life for its characters, including a trip to the hospital and a tour of someone's room.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A zine with poems and short stories that revolve around the central theme of envy. In these short stories and poems, it is shown what kind of actions envy-driven people do, and touch on the consequences of those actions too. This is the first part to a series called the "Seven Deadly Zines," based on the seven cadinal sins.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This is an assemblage zine, or a zine with a compilation of unrelated texts, which were extracted from the author's undergraduate thesis "The Mythological Nature of Science Fiction in the Dune Series." Despite this, 'Instead Of' still spins a love story in a futuristic setting about a lover who thinks love is greater than the fact and fiction of death itself.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A photozine of black and white photography of things that are familiar in color. This zine features 20 images of things once familiar in color, but made refreshing in black and white. MON√òmania, a black and white photofest in the Philippines prompted Glenn to self-publish 'intro.'

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This contents of this zine, published by Saturnino Basilla in Manila, was collaborated on by nine different women. The zine Includes three trading cards that reference to different submissions inside the zine. The zine gives a bigger reference to the Thai comedy film Iron Ladies.

did.unittitle: Is It Okay If I Just Look At You Lovingly For A While

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This zine includes a series of single-page drawings of a gay man going on relationship ventures. He has to figure out whether to follow his brain, his heart, or his libido, as he tries to overcome his self-perceptions about his partner/s.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A multimedia zine that has collages, photos, and musings. Mostly, it's a zine about cheap food and being a broke college student.

did.unittitle: Ito ang Pangalan Ng Aking Mga Dila

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The lines for this Filipino poem is written by Estela Vadal, an artificial intelligence created by Marlon Hacla. The poignant lines in this poem go in alphabetical order, and have been picked and edited by Maron Hacla for being his AI's best lines.

did.unittitle: The Jesus Rocket / I Think My Dog is Pro-Du30 / Danger Man

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: From a religious cult bearing 300 rockets to take them to a holier, place, to a shih tzu that seems to have a psychic connection to Rodrigo Duterte, to a romantic relationship tested by a cheap carnival attraction and poor handling of money, this zine-style mini-collection features Marguerite Alcazaren de Leon's latest stories, each with an illustration also by the author.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A zine with illustrations dedicated to depicting Jose Rizal, the Philippine's national hero, in different art styles and forms.

did.unittitle: Just a Bunch of Short Stories

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This is a collection of 8 unrelated short stories printed and bound together by a paper fastener. The short stories are marked by the year they are written, ranging from 2009-2012, and follow no particular theme.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Kapitan Bayaran is a Tagalog comic by Joanne Cesario and Michelle Bacabac, and published by 502 Komiks in 2013. It is about a college student, Albert, who wakes up one day and discovers he can read minds and decides to make a business out of it. This comic talks about college students and their concerns with being far away from home, not being able to afford college, student politics, grades, and romantic affairs.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A one-shot comic about a taxi driver who is experiencing his occupation become obsolete because of Uber and Grab. Despite the hard times, he has faith that President Rodrigo Duterte will uplift the hardworking and the poor.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This item is a one-sided accordion zine (leporello) created by Rolf Campos and dedicated to Don M. Salubayba, a fellow visual artist, and mentor, who passed away. With Don's work characterized by its chaotic dreaminess, and a tendency to sprawl over the surface utilized, the homage becomes apparent through the small details of Rolf's doodles of their adventures together.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A comic about a lesbian engineer and demoness who share a contract. The demoness predicts the future for the engineer so she can gamble to earn money, and the engineer pays her back with a kiss.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A compilation of quirky, silly comic strips drawn by Andoyman from 2015-2016 that even draw on political commentary with humor. They are comics that are derived from the soul, making the content fairly personal, despite seriousness.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Komik About Komiks. This comic is the printed version of a web comic and informative website aimed to promote local, independent komik culture in the Philippines, which is resurfacing again after the initial decline due to censorship during Marcos' martial law. In this comic, two young adults are inspired through a meet-and-greet with a famous komik artist. The artist gives them step-by-step advise on how to start their own komik, and how to navigate the world of publishing.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Krus na Ligaw translates to 'Lost Cross' and is comprised of poems, prose, and visual art compiled by writers from the University of the Philippines, Diliman. With Tagalog poems about the sleep deprived, to stories about simbang gabi, to text art based on single word prompts, Krus na Ligaw provides a wide assortment of stories about journeys, personal or literally.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Kung Alam Ko Lang translates to "If Only I Knew." Originally a spoken word poem, Brian Vee wrote this poem for his mother to express his love, gratefulness, and longing for her after she died. Aside from the spoken word poem, a bonus comic, screenshots, and more stories that share his relationship with his mother are included.

did.unittitle: Kung Pwede Lang Sanang Kainin Ang Zine Na Ito

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: "If Only This Zine Could Be Eaten" is the English translation of this zine's title, hinting at what the content of the poems and stories inside are going to be about. In the Philippines, most people are no stranger to poverty and the painful hunger it brings upon communities. The stories and poems in this zine show a sliver of some of the devastating economic conditions that pushes people to go as far as beg on the streets and develop addictions to inhaling fumes of an adhesive just to curb their hunger.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This printed tour of an exhibition by Mark Vincent in the Sining Makiling Gallery at UP Los Banos is a critique on the culture of consumption in the Philippines. The pieces in Lamon reproduces eating traditions and paints them in a way that reflects the power struggle between consumers and capitalists. The popular figures and icons that are recreated in this exhibit serve to remind viewers the history and politics of the media they usually consume and are currently consuming.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This zine has an assortment of content ranging from photography of supermarkets and graffiti filled walls, collages, and a song lyrics with chords. The most common reccuring image throughout the zine is a small, black, paper fastener puppet.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This is a screenplay about two girls who accidentally meet on a rooftop in Metro Manila with the intention of jumping from it.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A zine with illustrations inspired by lyrics to the song "Lazy Sunday," a song that is also by the National Embarrassment. The lyrics are visually incorporated with the collage that is influenced by a surrealist art style.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A 2-color risograph zine printed by Bad Student in Manila, Philippines. The pink and blue zine utilizes the white, or empty space for the images.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Essays, stories, and photostills that were inspired by the experiences and musings that are born after one wanders around. The stories and the poems in this zine are in Cebuano, a Visayan language.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: License to Quest is a one-shot comic by Luigi Jocson or "Lui421." In this world, heroes and adventurers make a living from quests that allow them to embark on adventures outside of the city.

did.unittitle: Life Is Short Art Is Long

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A zine with collages and musings the lifespan and immortality of an artist and their art.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A small zine about love published by UP UGAT. In this zine, 17 students contributed their own short stories love as they interpret it.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A story about a strained couple on a long weekend to salvage their declining relationship.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Short Filipino stories and poems that compares the journey of writing to the journey of coming home to L√≥ngos, a bottleneck area in Cavite. Different pieces in this zine was written by people from the Cavite Young Writers Association (CYWA). These Cavite√±os often make references to their hometowns, even with the diverse topics of the short stories and poems.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This is a compilation of comics that consists of subsersive images and messages. The panels feature lots of recreational drug use and graphic content of distorted bodies.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A collection of poems and photography that presents Manila as a colorful, bustling city-especially at night.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This is the first few chapters to Boon Lauw's novel that is a work in progress. The story is set during the martial law, and characters who embarked the mountains to be part of the war to end it.

did.unittitle: Maliit lang 'yung sa 'yo, itabi mo, magpadaan ka: Adventures in Parataxis

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: In this zine, 9 conversations between the author and the taxi driver are transcribed in paratactic form. By putting the exchanges next to each other without indicating who said what, the significance of who is speaking is diminished. This way, the emphasis leans towards what is said in the conversation rather than who said it. These conversations reflect the street smarts of the taxi drivers, as it becomes evident that they hold more information about the cities and streets than the passenger.

did.unittitle: Manila Automat Annual Comics Round Up

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This is a compilation of comics by Mica Agregado. The comic panels touch on different subjects-the artist's frustration and self doubt about drawing, a quiet take on the Rapture, a story about mourning, and a panel about a dream.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This introduces us to Mica Agregado as an artist struggling out internal and external hardships when it comes to making comics. Each page shows a different hurdle to overcome as an artist, but the insecurity and peer pressure to conform to other artists is especially highlighted within the pages.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Manimalaman is a collaboration zine published by Ang INK (Ilustrador ng Kabataan). The title is derived from the combination of the words man + animal + halaman (plant). Each submission is an artist's original character with the combined traits of a man, animal, and halaman. The submissions also come with a short back story or description of the diverse hybrid creatures.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Printed in color, this zine illustrates a walk through what a common wet market or palengke in the Philippines would look like. Shown are stands for fruit, vegetables, fish, poultry, Filipino desserts like kakanin and an area for miscellaneous items like pots, pans, and baskets.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A zine filled with poems, flash fiction, and a short story that provides a glimpse into a marriage.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This anthology by artists from BLINK (Blue Indie Komiks) features work with the central theme of the eye, with the genre of the contents ranging from horror to suspense.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A collection of poems from members of University of the East's Drama Company. The mix of Filipino and English poems in this zine reminisce about the lingering pain of heart break from being left behind by a past lover, or a family member.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A fanzine of two Overwatch characters speculated to have a relationship by fans. The zine portrays the two characters outside of their traditional setting and context of the video game.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A photozine with black and white photography of people waiting for their food at restaurants, food, and the people food is shared with. The photos, along with the few words that accompany them, aim to express that that the food we eat, and the people we eat it with, are the experiences that we keep.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A selection of drawings, events, musings, observations of the odd and otherworldly. This zine filled with Zeus Bacon 's eerie, and sometimes vulgar, depictions of the otherworldly was printed in Manila, Philippines in 2016.

did.unittitle: HOW MANY ITEMS? Medyo Gabi And Yet

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Taglish poems in this zine depict a drunken walk home between the narrator and the subject of their romantic interest. Drunken ideas of how to salvage the people of the Philippines from poverty are suggested by the poet, all of which the other person denies doing because he believes the revolution is not going to be catalyzed by one person, but rather, the Masa or the People. The poems go on to describe the fray that is Manila, and wonder, how can they still feel love for this person despite being in the midst of collective despair?

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This photozine contains a series of monochromatic photos of Alperr's daily traverse that highlights the beauty, despite the stress and hardship, of riding the public transit.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: These poems and flash stories are Nikolas' last will and testament. The first part is dedicated to people in his life-father, mother, sister, best friend, and ex-lover. The second part is dedicated to the places that have left a mark on him, and the last part is to his ex-lover.

did.unittitle: Mga Kwento Sa Loob At Labas Ng Pila

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Comic strips to tell stories of people waiting in long, inconvenient lines.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Original, purple watercolor paintings and designs on watercolor paper. The paintings often obscure the face of the painting's subject.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Real conversations between Lyra and Don about art and the art scene in the Philippines. Cartoon strips also serve as a commentary on how capitalistic or pretentious said scene can get.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A mini-comic in Filipino about a boy learning to stand up to his bullies.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This zine is about a witch doctor, Ria, who made a baby with magic while her husband was away gathering magical herbs.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A multimedia zine with poems, art, and comics in both English and Filipino to debunk the idea that mental health struggles are just myths. Each piece shows vulnerability and perspectives from different people who are going through mental health struggle.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A zine in Taglish explaining what being "trash" means through an introduction, and showing examples of it in illustrations and comic panels. Being "trash" is self-described by Asshulz as the act of making bad decisions, acknowledging it, and then making some more.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This artzine is a compilation of different local artist's works to showcase the diverse and unique styles of their craft.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A comic on how to stay motivated while creating comics. The advise spans from how to handle time management, to how to digest harsh, constructive criticism.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A compilation of acrylic paintings that mostly depicts excessively greedy eaters through paintings that emphasize the mouth, teeth, and monsters.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This zine is a compilation of poems by students at the University of the Philippines, Los Ba√±os. The title of the poem is an indicator of the content's focus on eating disorders. 'Mula Sa Mualan' translates to "From a Full Mouth" and dig deep into the feelings of those recovering or still struggling with eating disorders.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A collection of Filipino poems that do not share an overarching theme, but are part of her broader poetry project. The poems have won the Palanca Memorial Awards for Literature in the past.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Through code poetry, this zine provides a criticism on the high demands of academics that has contributed to the development of paranoia and depression amongst students. Several lesson plans are laid out ironically, and made to seem absurd from the work load and complication of combining literature and coding.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A colorful zine about food. It includes illustrations and photographs of food, as well as a few words on mannerisms around food.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A zine about "small slaves" who wonder about their existence and purpose. The munting alagad are all identical, and are all drawn in the same sketchy art style. The munting alagad all speak in Taglish

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A one-shot comic dedicated to the creator's anniversary with her boyfriend.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A collection of short stories that have gore, paranormal, and psychological elements for a horror-themed zine. Aside from the stories, this zine has bizarre and dream-like illustrations for each story.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This zine is a photo diary of the artist from the past few years, years which were mostly devoted to graffiti art. The photos feature portraits of people, nature and skylines, artists making graffiti, but mostly graffiti covered anything-from walls, to small boats, and vans.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Comic panels about the common trials and tribulations of aspiring comic artists.

did.unittitle: nihil vers: ode to deCo - art - app

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This zine is a combination of text and illustrations. The text expresses the discontentment and dissent against the repression and violation of human rights.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This zine is about defying stereotypes and has illustrations and quotes made by various artists, writers and figures to supplement the message.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This is an anthology of true horror stories based on interviews over beer and coffee with a policeman, a doctor, and an old, retired doctor. This anthology of Filipino horror stories was published in Manila, Philippines.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This family zine matches the topic of food and meals with colorful and vibrant Illustrations. It plays with the idea of things that are hard to swallow, provides recipes for tofu sandwiches and chickenpeas curry, includes a short story about the 2017 avian flu breakout in Central Luzon.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Nomads Quarterly is a literary and arts magazine that includes fictions, essays/reviews, poetry, art pieces, and interviews. The submissions in the first issue included submissions in English, Tagalog, and Cebuano, including an interview with Butch Bandillo, who is considered to be the "father of modern Cebuano poetry." The magazine welcomes submissions, as well as financial contributions to sustain the publication.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A short zine with illustrations of various types of paper, from newspaper, advertisements, sticky notes, mail, and others. It also includes news and ideas about the Duterte administration.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A short collection of comics and drawings by Vaughn Pinpin that follow the vanities and misfortunes of his life.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A zine of poems written over the course of many years. The poems reference everyday life, music, food and drive through the city.

did.unittitle: One Night, I Dreamt Of White Moths.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A black and white comic about a dream the narrator has about white moths. The narrator focuses on terminal illness, death and stories of mourning she's experienced.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This zine is packed with various black and white cartoons, illustrations, and doodles. It includes a short comic on how Pinocchio's little brother came to be, illustrations of bike-riding monsters, and deathly pop-locking.

did.unittitle: The Outer Garden: A Few More Blossoms

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Stories and poems that provide a different perspective to Genesis, or how the world as we know it came to be.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This zine is a compilation of "bugto" or Tagalog riddles. Each riddle is written in various calligraphy styles and accompanied by doodles.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: "Memorizing Pronouns," has monochromatic photos paired with the notes from a dream, and are printed on tracing paper that has been handstitched together, then published in Dumaguete City, Negros Oriental, Philippines in 2017.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Filipino poems that heavily reference European art and artists in its title. The poems allude to the struggles a person has with dealing with the heavy, restrictive church.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This is a comic about Dark Cupid, who follows Cupid around and pulls their arrow out, causing the loss of love and heartbreak.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Paper Monster Press is transgenre zine that started in Cavite, Philippines in 2010. There are both Tagalog and English works in this zine, which are separated in the page of contents. Each issue revolves around a different theme and includes illustrations, literature, and music playlists from different authors and artists around the world.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: An anthology of different one-shot comics about unrequited love, pining, and heartbreak. These were inspired by Session Road's song, "Gusto Lang Kita Makita."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This zine contains 47 worn and simple jeepney vinyl decal art as a tribute to Philippine's 7,107 islands. These vignettes portray scenes and themes from Filipino reality, often using images of mountains, palm trees, beaches, boats, and citylines.

did.unittitle: Penzette - ang dyornal ng mga Lagalag

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Penzette, based on the dish Pancit, is a journal of and by nomadic writers who tell stories of hardship and poverty.

did.unittitle: Penzette - ang dyornal ng mga Laglag

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A small, 10 page, accordion zine with black and white photos with the subject of the photo lingering at the corners or edges of the frame.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This zine is about Pia, a young albularyo or witch doctor, who is awakened by a spirit that the agimat necklace around her neck follows.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This features two one-shot comics. The first is in Isang Tagalog and is about Angelito, a poor boy trying to rise up to the world to write a letter for a chance to meet the girl of his dreams. The second comic is in English, and is about a pig that is oblivious to its situation of getting fattened to be butchered.

did.unittitle: Pinay Feminist Playbook: Notes on Presidential Chauvinism

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: There notes on presidential chauvinism call out the way President Rodrigo Duterte has perpetuated the culture of machismo and chauvinism in the Philippines. In this zine, Duterte has been quoted, and proven to be a promoter of adultery and disregard to women's dignity. The essays in this zine emphasize the need for women to be treated with respect, and how the current administration disregards laws and common human decency that ensures that.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A Filipino-made collection of stories and art surrounding LGBTQ+ characters and their monster boyfriends from Philippine mythology.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This zine contains a short story that references Dr. Elisabeth K√ºbler-Ross' 5 stages of grief and loss. The story takes place in a dentist's office, where the main character inches towards the dawn and acceptance of their own death.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A compilation of doodles with words and scribbles that have been piling up in Gatusby's office drawer. Most of them contain puns and references to pop culture.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A poblacion is considered the commercial and industrial center in a municipality. This zine contains photographs, prose, and poems about different stories of people leaving and being left behind in these old towns for the city.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A series of short stories that range from a retired activist standing by the lines of louder, younger ones, a first date gone right, a small glimpse of corruption in an Immigration Bureau office, and more.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A chapbook of poetry and fiction published by Kalapati Retrograde in Manila, Philippines. The poems and fictional stories in the chapbook are on pages that are formatted to mimic a prescription pad. Many of the poems and stories allude to Biblical references and death.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A comic about a boy who procrastinates doing his homework so much that they start to haunt his dreams.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This zine contains collaged images of Western and Eastern artworks, blueprints, product labels, and various snippets of writing. Under the title, it says "sa hirap at sa ginhawa," which is a Filipino wedding vow translating to "through hardship and through ease."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A zine that contains a short, 5-chapter story about two office workers, one a promising upcoming actress, and the other the man who has taken a liking to her.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Pseudocuments: Volume Two was printed in Diliman, Quezon City. The zine contains both published, but mostly unpublished collection of files, facts, figures, photopgrahs, and images.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This zine contains vibrant illustrations by Archilles Parallon. The illustrations have little context, but the red, yellow, and blue color scheme used on the cover implies that the title's classic greeting and call is directed at Filipinos. A few of the illustrations take on themes of Filipino culture and resistance.

did.unittitle: The Purest and Saddest Form of Seduction

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This zine contains poems and geometric art. It describes art itself as the purest and saddest form of seduction, talks about the allure of having the ability to put color onto a white canvas, of having an artists' touch bring something into life.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Puso'y Dos is a title that entails the heart being broken in two. From romantic pining, betrayal, break-ups, loss of a parent, and more-different forms of heartbreak are expressed through the poems and short stories in the zine.

did.unittitle: Qu'est-ce Qui Avee Dirty Sanchez? A Serious Guide to Erotic Poetry

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This zine is a guide by Hjorleif Sichauco, a Norwegian-Filipino writer, on how to write erotic poetry. Hjorleif encourages to find the Sex in other aspects of life outside of the act itself. The zine breaks down how to express certain sentiments or lines so that they are more sensual and convincing. This zine introduces a process for writing about sex conducted that falls under the guidelines of statistical methods in medical mesearch.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Rated XYZ is a zine that includes poems and short stories that revolve around the theme of oppression, resistance, and corruption in the Philippines. The second issue is a single piece: a long letter, along with song lyrics, for a friend who has passed away. The second issue is a letter written before committing suicide. The zines were published and distrubuted in Cavite, Philippines.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Regla is the slang term for menstruation periods in the Philippines. Some of the depictions include a cartoon depiction of period-havers as a restless wrestler and wolfman in a fight, literally melting into a monster, and having daggers for eyes.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A zine about the journey of two people learning how to navigate a long-distance relationship. The things mentioned in this zine reflect what must be let go, and what must be kept, in order for the long-distance relationship to survive. This zine is a 2-color risograph zine printed by Bad Student in Manila, Philippines.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A Pokemon zine about a heartbroken trainer and their level 5 Rowlet. An underachieving pokemon trainer who decides to go back home with their Pokemon after a few adventures.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Rescusitation is a zine with different watercolor illustrations of lungs, accompanied by poetry. The lungs become central to these poems, as they become the site for metaphors about grief, mental illness, and heartbreak.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Rue is a zine about a relationship that is slowly falling apart. The title takes on two meanings: Rue as in the evergreen plant, and rue as in regret. The story of the digressing relationship was punctuated with how the different plants in the garden bookmarked their relationship. One saw this garden as the only source of comfort and happiness, and the other was never as mindful or understanding of that fact.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Each poem, created by blacking out the lines around certain words or phrases, is a reference to the rules of love created based on De Amore of Andreas Capellanus. The poems are collaborated by different poets to show a more cynical take on love by writing about how these rules are broken, and how love causes suffering. Printed on the back page is a short definition of love, surrounded with photos of birds and their names to show how fleeting love is.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A story about a man who runs into two childhood friends after returning to his hometown to find himself.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This is a collection of Filipino poems about separation, distance, and heartbreak.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This is a visual diary about a girl who is negatively impacted by polycystic ovary syndrone, physically, emotionally and mentally.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A visual autobiographical zine about being a sexual assault survivor and the emotional vulnerabilities that impact her body image, sexual experiences, coping mechanisms and mental health.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This is an autobiographical zine published by Manila, Philippine's Albert Sy in October 2012. The zine featuers childhood photos and drawings from his "salad days," 1986-2006, when he was still young and inexperienced with life. The photos start with him as a baby, to being a young schoolboy, and to being a young man who skates and goes to punk shows.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: After Ma-las the sorcerer died, many attempted to rob the temple where he used to live. This is a story the curse of the sorcerer's mirror, and how it traps anyone who dares to come and take its power in an infinite loop.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: These zines provide samples of illustrations, doodles, and graphic designs by Nelz Yumul. Everything in this zine are done digitally and serve to showcase Yumul's different illustration techniques. The samples in these zines includes original ideas, but also borrows some characters such as ones from Star Wars and the Marvel Universe.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A compilation of sketches of a wide assortment of things that can be found at home.

did.unittitle: Say Your Peace Now: A Hang 'Em High Supplement

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This serves as an accompanying catalog for Hang 'Em High exhibition that occurred from March 8-29 in 2014.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Seeing Double is a zine printed by Polly Patch, an up and coming clothing brand based in Quezon City. Encased in a matching envelope, this pink and purple pastel zine showcases different illustrations of girls-always double in numbers-in fashionable attires and artsy poses.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Three chapters to a coming-of-age story that centers around the idea of the "seventh sense." The seventh sense is emotions, and these chapters shows how complex and sensitive these things are.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Dustin Celestino's selected works of politically incorrect sexual comedy. Designed as a script, these works are meant to be performed out loud in order to convey the comedy, and create a culture that accepts sex as part of people's lives.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A horror anthology ranging from a virus zombie outbreak, to a possessed little girl, and finally, to a mishap in a broken elevator. Each story is accompanied by illustrations that give visuals to horror stories that entail.

did.unittitle: The shortest 12 hours of my life

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Show Your Solution is comic about a student who has a nightmare about an apple monster attacking him after failing to show their solution for a word problem that involved apples. The "Ibang Kalokohan," which translates to "the other follies" features more illustrations of different monsters.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This zine utilizes the disjointed feeling of collages and black out poetry in order to show the distress and turmoil caused by radiation. It alludes to the trauma experienced by those whose families and homes were ravaged by nuclear war.

did.unittitle: Sigue Sigue Philippine Criminal and Gang Tattoo Sampler

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This zine is a tattoo sampler with illustrations based on the tattoos of criminals and gang members in the Philippines photographed by Sidney Snoeck, a Manila based photographer. The foreword written by Manuel Alvero, talks about the implication of these tattoos, and the difference between its meaning and its significance. The zine includes a free sample of a silkscreened postcard, and was printed in Manila, Philippines.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A comic book anthology that has 10 different stories and illustrations within it. The stories range from very domestic topics like a couple going through pregnancy, to superheroes, to a spy couple.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A small zine that calls to action to wage a revolution. The title translates to "Those who are charged to." This zine describes different reasons why the people must wage a revolution, which is the solution for the poverty that causes people to die.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A mini-cookbook on how to make sinigang. It includes the necessary ingredients, the instructions, and the memories attached to making food alone, or with a loved one.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A comic about two girls who find sisterhood in the most unexpected situations. They help one another from the moment they met as one was crying in the bathroom because of her biological sister, the other was trying to get out of a bad date.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A collection of short stories about lovers, and deeper descriptions and stories about Small City, a dream city. Each page also has a minimalistic illustration that pertains to the words on the page.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A poetry zine that has both English and Filipino poems that carry religious themes to tell stories about absence, displacement, hardship, and love.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This is a zine with poems written in English and Tagalog that brings the idea that every moment that passes by is a moment that brings everyone closer to the inevitable end. It does so in a matter-of-fact way that doesn't paint death in fear, but rather, in a subtle sadness. Each poem is printed on a page that uses a different photo as the background, making some pages vibrant and others dull.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series has two versions: the kid's version and the adult's version. The covers of the zines show an identical drawing of a pinned location that says "You are there," but as you flip through the pages of each zine, you will immediately notice the difference of the content inside. These two versions have plenty of illustration that match, but it aims to show that there are phrases that will mean something different because it is in a different context of time, while there are some that will remain the same.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Spilled Milk is a zine by Patti Vallejo that that was published in July 2013. It is a zine focused on the objectification of women.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Split is a zine published in Quezon City, Philippines in 2014. The zine contains three short stories and one poem that deal with topics surrounding complicated relationships that involve adultery, murder, and obsession.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Ni√±o Balita's artbook, in which he used squiggly lines to portray images from pop culture. Balita claims that this artbook is full of imperfections, but embraces it as a reflection of who he is as an artist.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A mini-collection of standalone stories and illustrations. The first story is about an artist who makes and burns effigies of the Philippine president as an act of protest, but finds himself questioning the passion behind his work while attending a high-art gala. The second is about a Filipino backpacker in Thailand who realized they didn't have to travel that distance to see what was in front of them. And the last is about a lovelorn kindergarten teacher who takes extra meaures to secure a good love life, which backfires on her.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This is a collection of short comic strips that are mostly auto-biographical, highlighting some dilemmas that Rob's been going through, but partly things he's never done or experienced. It's a mish-mash of humorous comic strips on how to navigate life, freelancing, and drawing for drawing's sake.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A series of poems about a girl who shuns the expectations of the Catholic church and practice for her to be demure and chaste. The poems indicate that her behavior is rooted in her mother's, because her mother's implied promiscuity

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A photozine in black and white featuring the many street dogs, or "askal," that roam the streets of Manila.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
