scopecontent.p: Stories shared between members of Kasarianlan, an LGBT group that promotes gender equality and offers a safe space in the Polytechnic University of the Philippines. The stories are told through some photographs and sparse sentences that revolve around insecurity and intimacy.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This zine shows 7 different perspectives of a person. The perspectives are disorienting, but all allude to the main chracter having multile personality disorder.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The pages in this item include doodles, screenshots, and photos of various elements from the death/doom metal subculture scene. Some pages entail mature, raw, and gritty imagery that include swatsikas, body gore, and antichrist imagery.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The title of this zine translates to "to stick in between, to suck." The zine contains five Tagalog poems, and two English ones.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: From spring chickens, to grandparents, to womanhood, Swill is a collection of short poems. As the title implies, it is a poem dump of sorts.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This is a zine by an anonymous creator. It delves into the topics of expecations, worth, and depression leading into suicidal ideation. Taking a dictionary-like format, each page has a word in Baybayin and Filipino, followed by an English translation and definition.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This contains the creation story of supernatural beings in the Philippines. It begins by explaining why these creatures ceased to walk among humans, and goes into introducing and describing the powers, appearance, and temperament of the many, different supernatural creatures in the Philippines. The creatures featured and illustrated are: tikbalang, kapre, duwende, mambabarang, babaeng nakaputi, sarangay, siyokoy, nuno sa punso, tiyanak, manananggal, tiyanak, santelmo, ang pugot, aswang, sirena, bakunawa, mangkukulam, bungisngis, batibat, and diwata.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Attitude of the Mind, the third volume to Teaching Exhibitions, inspires the way art is taught and consumed to include "listening to" and not just "looking at" the art. This zine introduces the student to the life, work, and music of the Filipino composer and ethnomusicologist Jos√© Maceda.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This zine mimics the form of a letter. By breaking down language, it mimics an English language lesson, and exposes that, collaged words photocopied together. Exposes the pain of war through language. The terms of coexistence between a native language and a colonized one.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 'Theo' is a four-part play about a graduate student faced with a writing block for his thesis.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This is a compilation of daily drawings for the month of February.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A collection of poems in English about joy, and the reluctance to pursue it because of the fear of the unknown.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Stories, illustrations, and photos. A zine packed with a story, illustrations, and photos addressed as a long letter from L to E. The story is about a young woman finally letting herself grieve and let go of a past lover, who was also her bestfriend.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Tip the Waiter is a collection of the "tips" that Elbert Or leaves for the staff of restaurants and cafes he's visited in 2010-2014. In the Philippines, where tipping the service is not a normalized practice, Elbert leaves doodles and quotes on napkins and receipts for their waiter on top of their actual monetary tips.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Tira Tira, or "leftovers" is a zine that illustrates the different things and sentiments left behind as someone moves out of their home. The illustrations include different spots in a house, as well as a blueprint of the small, memory-filled home.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This zine introduces Tish Dela Cruz's writing style, and show multiple short stories and dialogues about relationships, smoking, and more internal musings.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Tula[K] is a play on the words "tula" which means poem, and "tulak" which means push. This zine contains poems about drug pushers and users in the Philippines. The stories and poems are about "tambays" or loiterers who are jobless and/or uneducated, and push or use drugs due to the lack of activity to do.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: In a fast-paced, non-stop world, there is rarely any chance to stop and stare. This zine provides short poems that provides the chance to pay attention to our surroundings, and the chance to observe what we are going through.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This tiny zine contains a short, lyrical story about a woman who longs for her lover.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Four silent comics about different ailments of the body. The physical distress felt with a cough, a wound, a fever, and flaking skin are visually and conceptually exaggerated.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This is a self-publsihed zine created in 2014 that brings a modern take on local Filipino folklore monsters. The mini-comic shows the story of Orya, a manananggal who tries to hide her secret under a coat but with no avail, and the story of her budding relationship with a female aswang, which is another monster in local Filipino folklore.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A compilation of short stories and poems about a childhood rewritten in a non-fantastical style. Rather, the poems and short stories take on an eerie tone, even if the stories are about and of childhood.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Vandalisms with Citations is a zine that reveals the tension between the private and the public, the accepted and the criminalized. Citing quotes that have been tagged onto a public space (walls, doors, etc.) is symbolic and a literal crime.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A poem creatd for the purpose of being performed at Deus Sex Machina. This playful script is about sex positivity, and spreading awareness and openness about kinks, particularly BDSM.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This picture-zine has portrait drawings of people accompanied by short quotes that reflect small, irrational fears in life.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This zine contains personal poems written by Sachi Siqiojor during her 10-day stay in a psychiatry ward. After trying to commit suicide three times, Sachi had confronted some of the problems that have been plaguing and intensifying her mental illnesses. The poems are accompanied by illustrations that give a glimpse of what it looks like to live with the symptoms of her anxiety and depression.

did.unittitle: We Need No Fire To Warm Us

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This is a catalog of Allan Balisi's solo exhibition at Blanc Gallery. The title of the exhibit implies the artist's desire to stop being dependent on things we used to rely on. The oil paintings symbolize the bare of human connection.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This is a compilation of satirical essays that critiques the backwards thinking, opinions, and laws prevalent in the Philippines. The first thing criticized is the opposition of the reproductive health act that gives universal access to contraceptions, fertility control, sexual education, and maternal care. The essays also delve into criticizing the influence of religion and the church over the Philippine government, as well as the way Filipinos rely on sex scandals to reprimand sexual deviance and further promote the feudal relationship of women having to be economically dependent to men.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Weather-Weather Lang is a comic by Norby Ela that was published in April 2014 and printed in the Philippines. The story follows a young Korean boy living in the Philippines, who had to endure the floods caused by a typhoon with his Filipino English teacher.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Wooty Baby is a zine that features chats with chatbots. It contains a transcribed conversation between lonely T-Bag and the sexbots who are trying to lure him into adult websites.

did.unittitle: the X files in more than 50 shades of grey

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The x files in more than 50 shades of grey is a zine by MC Lonzano, who strives break the boundaries that create a narrow view on the understandng of women, their sexuality, and erotic art.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: One page, four panel comics based on Taglish puns and jokes.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This is the reading data of Hope Swann from the years 2013-2017. The type of data collected ranges from ranking of books read, genre of books read, and comparison of the data over the years.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This features 20 writing prompts with small doodles or illustrations to go with each one. These writing prompts range from giving lines to start and end with, to asking to personify inanimate objects and give them characters.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A multimedia zine series that go by "seasons" or themes. In the Orchid season the theme is to bloom; in the Moth Season , it is about rebirth; in the Spider Season is about building; and the Lightning Season is for illumination. The central theme for each zine is reflected through poetry, collages, and ramblings not only by the original creators of the zine, but also by their "adopted animals" or new members who've submitted pieces for the zine.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This comic, which was inspired by the song "Labor of Love" by Bjork, is a true story from Aurora's own journey through pregnancy.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A visual account of dreams and thoughts by the author. The illustrations in each page are ambigious, but paired with words on each page. It is about an existence gaining consciousness, experiencing life, and seeing the end of it.
